intro: Bisnaga haematacantha, commonly known as the bloodroot, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has a single, upright stem with palmate leaves that are deeply divided. Its flowers are typically 2–3 inches in diameter and are borne on short pedicels. Bisnaga haematacantha is often found in moist, wooded areas and is known for its medicinal properties.
